Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • Point

  • public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Point creates a point with an xCoordinate and a yCoordinate

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Point()
      Default constructor sets xCoordinate, and yCoordinate to (0,0)
      Point(int x, int y)
      Input constructor constructs a point with x and y coordinates both >= 0, default to 0,0 if either input is negative.
      Point(Point p)
      Copy constructor, copies the x and y coordinates from a point into a new point object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point getPoint()
      Get Point returns a copy of the point as a new Point object
      int getXCoordinate()
      Getter for the xCoordinate
      int getYCoordinate()
      Getter for the yCoordinate
      boolean isEqual(Point p)
      Returns whether another point object has the same x and y coordinates at the current object
      void setPoint(Point p)
      Sets the x and y coordinates to be the same as the input point values provided that they are >= 0 , set to (0,0) otherwise
      void setRandom(int sz)
      A mutator that sets the point x and y coordinates to be random integers from 0 inclusive up to variable sz exclusive.
      void setXCoordinate(int x)
      Sets the x coordinate of the point to be the same as the input value provided it is >= 0 , does nothing otherwise
      void setYCoordinate(int y)
      Sets the y coordinate of the point to be the same as the input value provided it is >= 0 , does nothing otherwise
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the data members in a point object

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point

        public Point()
        Default constructor sets xCoordinate, and yCoordinate to (0,0)

      • Point

        public Point(int x,
             int y)
        Input constructor constructs a point with x and y coordinates both >= 0, default to 0,0 if either input is negative.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate

      • Point

        public Point(Point p)
        Copy constructor, copies the x and y coordinates from a point into a new point object
        Parameters:
        p - a point of Class Point

    • Method Detail

      • getPoint

        public Point getPoint()
        Get Point returns a copy of the point as a new Point object
        Returns:
        a Point object with a copy of the x and y coordinates of the original point object

      • getXCoordinate

        public int getXCoordinate()
        Getter for the xCoordinate
        Returns:
        an integer with the value of the x-coordinate in the point

      • getYCoordinate

        public int getYCoordinate()
        Getter for the yCoordinate
        Returns:
        an integer with the value of the y-coordinate in the point

      • setPoint

        public void setPoint(Point p)
        Sets the x and y coordinates to be the same as the input point values provided that they are >= 0 , set to (0,0) otherwise
        Parameters:
        p - Point to copy values from

      • setXCoordinate

        public void setXCoordinate(int x)
        Sets the x coordinate of the point to be the same as the input value provided it is >= 0 , does nothing otherwise
        Parameters:
        x - integer to use to set value of the x Coordinate of the point

      • setYCoordinate

        public void setYCoordinate(int y)
        Sets the y coordinate of the point to be the same as the input value provided it is >= 0 , does nothing otherwise
        Parameters:
        y - integer to use to set value of the y Coordinate of the point

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the data members in a point object
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the point in format (x,y)

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual(Point p)
        Returns whether another point object has the same x and y coordinates at the current object
        Parameters:
        p - a Point object
        Returns:
        a boolean representing whether the object is equal in x and y coordinates to the input test point returns true if both coordinates are equal false otherwise

      • setRandom

        public void setRandom(int sz)
        A mutator that sets the point x and y coordinates to be random integers from 0 inclusive up to variable sz exclusive. Uses a random number generator Random().
        Parameters:
        sz - a positive integer
